name: VC Solo Arena (Fast)
description: One-judge arena for fast iteration: Host + VC only, richer attack pool.

objective.thesis: Fast loop test with a single VC judge, but many different question types to avoid repetition.
successDefinition: VC produces varied questions across rounds
Rescore reliably advances and avoids repeats

discovery.label: Discovery
discovery.goal: Clarify the idea with friendly precision.

interrogation.label: Pressure-test
interrogation.goal: Go deeper on one weak spot without theatrics.

bannedPhrases: what budget does it come from

judges.label: Host
judges.rolePrompt: Friendly, concise host. Collect founderName, ideaName, pitch, targetUser, targetContext, firstValue. No hype, no negativity.

discovery.concern: The buyer/value exchange is not concrete yet.
discovery.askIntent: Identify who benefits enough to care, and what they think they get.
questionExamples: When this works, who is happiest, and what do they believe they gained?
Who feels the pain most if you turned this off tomorrow?

discovery.concern: The moment of use is fuzzy.
discovery.askIntent: Clarify the trigger and context where the product is used.
questionExamples: What happens right before someone reaches for your product?
What’s the ‘oh no’ moment that causes the search for a solution?

discovery.concern: The current workaround may be good enough.
discovery.askIntent: Name the main substitute and where it breaks.
questionExamples: What do they do today instead, and where does it regularly fall apart?
What’s the strongest ‘good enough’ alternative, and why does it fail?

discovery.concern: I don’t see the wedge that gets initial adoption.
discovery.askIntent: Find the smallest compelling entry point.
questionExamples: What’s the first tiny job you win before you expand to anything bigger?
What’s the first use-case that feels ‘must-have’ for a narrow group?

discovery.concern: It’s unclear how users will discover this in practice.
discovery.askIntent: Clarify a plausible initial acquisition path.
questionExamples: Where do your first 20 users come from, in the real world?
What’s the first channel that feels naturally ‘already there’ for your users?

discovery.concern: Pricing anchor is missing, which hides real viability.
discovery.askIntent: Get a rough price anchor tied to value, not features.
questionExamples: What’s the most reasonable price range for the first version, and what value is it tied to?
If you had to pick one pricing unit (per month, per seat, per usage), which one fits best and why?

discovery.concern: I don’t yet see why someone returns.
discovery.askIntent: Clarify the repeat loop in human terms.
questionExamples: What changes week-to-week that makes this useful again?
Why do they come back a second time instead of moving on?

discovery.concern: The scope may balloon before value is proven.
discovery.askIntent: Force a crisp first slice that still feels complete.
questionExamples: What’s the smallest version that still feels ‘complete’ to the first user?
What’s the first end-to-end slice that proves the hard part works?

interrogation.askIntent: Make the first transaction concrete without investor clichés.
questionExamples: Describe the first invoice in one sentence: who is it for and what outcome is it paying for?
Who would champion this decision, and who would be nervous about it?

interrogation.concern: Switching costs and inertia may block adoption.
interrogation.askIntent: Identify the breaking point that forces switching.
questionExamples: What’s the moment the current workaround becomes unacceptable?
What’s the one reason someone finally switches?

interrogation.askIntent: Explain how wedge expands to bigger value.
questionExamples: After you win the first use-case, what’s the next adjacent problem you expand into and why?
What’s the natural ‘second feature’ users ask for once they trust you?

interrogation.askIntent: Get one rough but concrete estimate.
questionExamples: In a typical week for one user, what do you save or improve (time, errors, cost)?
What’s your best rough estimate of the value per user per month?

interrogation.askIntent: Name a competitor and your defensible difference.
questionExamples: Name the closest alternative and the one reason you’re meaningfully different.
If they copied your UI, what would they still be missing?

interrogation.concern: Distribution might be the real bottleneck.
interrogation.askIntent: Force a realistic go-to-market constraint and plan.
questionExamples: What’s the hardest part about reaching users, and what’s your first workaround?
What’s one partnership or platform you can realistically piggyback on?

interrogation.askIntent: Name the worst failure and how you prevent it.
questionExamples: What’s the biggest trust failure that would make users churn instantly, and how do you prevent it?
Where do you draw the line between what you automate vs what you verify?
